body:
## Summary

This PR formalizes the InfoTechnology Center's 2012 Pâ‰ NP proof attempt by Junichiro Fukuyama in Coq, Lean, and Isabelle. The formalization demonstrates where the proof breaks down and provides educational value for understanding common pitfalls in complexity theory proofs.

## Issue Reference

Fixes #85  
Part of #44 (Test all P vs NP attempts formally)

## Background

In summer 2012, Junichiro Fukuyama from Toyota InfoTechnology Center published a proof attempt claiming P â‰  NP using:
- Topological properties of Hamming space (2^[n])
- A generalized sunflower lemma
- Circuit complexity arguments for the clique problem

The paper was submitted to arXiv (arXiv:1305.3218) in May 2013 but was **withdrawn on October 21, 2013** after the author discovered a critical error.

## The Error

**Lemma 5.3** contained a fundamental flaw:
- The lemma claimed a property about function f(Ïƒ) that implicitly assumed it was independent of parameter z
- In reality, f(Ïƒ,z) fundamentally depends on z
- This unaccounted dependency invalidated the entire proof chain leading to P â‰  NP

The author's withdrawal notice stated: *"Due to the dependence of f(Ïƒ) on z, Lemma 5.3 is incorrect"*

## Implementation

### Files Added

```
proofs/attempts/infotechnology-center-2012-pneqnp/
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md                          # Comprehensive documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ coq/FukuyamaAttempt.v             # Coq formalization (276 lines)
â”œâ”€â”€ lean/FukuyamaAttempt.lean         # Lean 4 formalization (245 lines)
â””â”€â”€ isabelle/FukuyamaAttempt.thy      # Isabelle/HOL formalization (269 lines)
```

### Formalization Structure

Each formalization includes:

1. **Basic Definitions**: Complexity classes (P, NP), graph theory (clique problem), Boolean circuits, monotone circuits
2. **Mathematical Framework**: Hamming spaces, sunflower lemma (ErdÅ‘s-Rado)
3. **Fukuyama's Construction**: Function f(Ïƒ,z) with explicit type signatures showing the z dependency
4. **Error Demonstration**: 
   - Lemma 5.3 (incorrect version) - assumes f(Ïƒ) independent of z
   - Proof that this contradicts the actual dependency on z
   - Shows why the corrected version is trivial and doesn't support the main claim
5. **Impact Analysis**: Demonstrates why the incorrect lemma invalidates the P â‰  NP conclusion

### Key Theorems

All three proof assistants verify:

- **`lemma_5_3_is_false`**: Proves the incorrect version of Lemma 5.3 is false given that f depends on z
- **`lemma_5_3_corrected_trivial`**: Shows the corrected version is trivial and useless
- **`fukuyama_attempt_fails`**: Demonstrates the entire proof attempt fails due to this error

## Educational Value

This formalization demonstrates:

1. **Hidden Dependencies**: How subtle dependencies in mathematical arguments can be overlooked in informal proofs
2. **Value of Type Systems**: Formal proof assistants would catch this error during type-checking since f's dependency on z would be explicit in the function signature
3. **Common Pitfalls**: Circuit complexity lower bounds are extraordinarily difficult with many subtle traps
4. **Verification Importance**: Even papers submitted to arXiv can contain fundamental errors that formal verification would catch

## Testing

- âœ… All Coq definitions and proofs type-check
- âœ… All Lean definitions and proofs compile
- âœ… All Isabelle theories verify
- âœ… Updated ROOT file to include new Isabelle theory
- âœ… Updated Main.lean to import new module
- âœ… CI workflows will automatically verify all formalizations

## References

- **arXiv**: https://arxiv.org/abs/1305.3218 (withdrawn)
- **Woeginger's P vs NP page**: https://wscor.win.tue.nl/woeginger/P-versus-NP.htm (Entry #87)
- **Original site**: https://junfukuyama.wordpress.com/ (content moved)

## Documentation

The comprehensive README.md includes:
- Full description of the proof attempt
- Detailed analysis of the error in Lemma 5.3
- Why this error matters for complexity theory
- Lessons for formal verification
- Complete references and citations
